critique: The document reflects President Roosevelt's approval of a Code of Fair Competition for the Women's Belt Industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act of 1933. This act was a key component of the New Deal, representing a significant expansion of federal power into economic regulation. The code aims to establish fair competition within the industry, indicating a move towards government intervention in the economy. The document also touches on the governance and representation within the National Association of Women's Belt Manufacturers, suggesting an interest in fair and inclusive practices.
